member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordChannel.GetMessages(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.ChannelMessagesRequest)
member.summary: Returns the messages for a channel. If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the VIEW_CHANNEL permission to be present on the current user. If the current user is missing the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission in the channel then this will return no messages (since they cannot read the message history). See Get Channel Messages

If the tts field is set to true, the SEND_TTS_MESSAGES permission is required for the message to be spoken. See Create Message

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordChannel.ListPublicArchivedThreads(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.ThreadArchivedLookup)
member.summary: Returns archived threads in the channel that are public. When called on a GUILD_TEXT channel, returns threads of type GUILD_PUBLIC_THREAD. When called on a GUILD_NEWS channel returns threads of type GUILD_NEWS_THREAD. Threads are ordered by archive_timestamp, in descending order. Requires the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY permission. See List Public Archived Threads
member.param: The options to use when looking up the archived threads

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordChannel.ListPrivateArchivedThreads(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.ThreadArchivedLookup)
member.summary: Returns archived threads in the channel that are of type GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD. Threads are ordered by archive_timestamp, in descending order. Requires both the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY and MANAGE_THREADS permissions. See List Private Archived Threads
member.param: The options to use when looking up the archived threads

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordChannel.ListJoinedPrivateArchivedThreads(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.ThreadArchivedLookup)
member.summary: Returns archived threads in the channel that are of type GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD, and the user has joined. Threads are ordered by their id, in descending order. Requires the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY permission. See List Joined Private Archived Threads
member.param: The options to use when looking up the archived threads

member.summary:
Represents a Scheduled Event Lookup Structure within Discord.
Provide a user id to before and after for pagination. Users will always be returned in ascending order by user_id. If both before and after are provided, only before is respected. Fetching users in-between before and after is not supported.

member.name: P:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.Id
member.summary: ID of the message

member.name: P:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.ChannelId
member.summary: ID of the channel the message was sent in

member.name: P:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.GuildId
member.summary: ID of the guild the message was sent in

member.name: P:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.Author
member.summary: The author of this message (not guaranteed to be a valid user) The author object follows the structure of the user object, but is only a valid user in the case where the message is generated by a user or bot user. If the message is generated by a webhook, the author object corresponds to the webhook's id, username, and avatar. You can tell if a message is generated by a webhook by checking for the webhook_id on the message object.

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.Create(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.Snowflake,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.MessageCreate)
member.summary: Post a message to a guild text or DM channel. If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the SEND_MESSAGES permission to be present on the current user. If the tts field is set to true, the SEND_TTS_MESSAGES permission is required for the message to be spoken. See Create Message
member.param: Channel ID to send the message to

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.CrossPostMessage(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.Snowflake)
member.summary: Crosspost a message in a News Channel to following channels. This endpoint requires the 'SEND_MESSAGES' permission, if the current user sent the message, or additionally the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission, for all other messages, to be present for the current user. See Crosspost Message

member.summary: Crosspost a message in a News Channel to following channels. This endpoint requires the 'SEND_MESSAGES' permission, if the current user sent the message, or additionally the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission, for all other messages, to be present for the current user. See Crosspost Message

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.CreateReaction(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordEmoji)
member.summary: Create a reaction for the message. This endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user. Additionally, if nobody else has reacted to the message using this emoji, this endpoint requires the 'ADD_REACTIONS' permission to be present on the current user. Valid emoji formats are the unicode emoji character '😀' or for custom emoji format must be <emojiName:emojiId> See Create Reaction

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.CreateReaction(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,System.String)
member.summary: Create a reaction for the message. This endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user. Additionally, if nobody else has reacted to the message using this emoji, this endpoint requires the 'ADD_REACTIONS' permission to be present on the current user. Valid emoji formats are the unicode emoji character '😀' or for custom emoji format must be <emojiName:emojiId> See Create Reaction

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.DiscordMessage.Edit(Oxide.Ext.Discord.Clients.DiscordClient,Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.MessageUpdate)
member.summary: Edit a previously sent message. The fields content, embed, allowed_mentions and flags can be edited by the original message author. Other users can only edit flags and only if they have the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission in the corresponding channel. When specifying flags, ensure to include all previously set flags/bits in addition to ones that you are modifying. Only flags documented in the table below may be modified by users (unsupported flag changes are currently ignored without error). See Edit Message
member.param: Update to be applied to the message

member.name: T:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.TeamRole
member.summary: Represents Team Role Types

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.TeamRole.Owner
member.summary: Owners are the most permissible role, and can take destructive, irreversible actions like deleting team-owned apps or the team itself. Teams are limited to 1 owner.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.TeamRole.Admin
member.summary: Admins have similar access as owners, except they cannot take destructive actions on the team or team-owned apps.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.TeamRole.Developer
member.summary: Developers can access information about team-owned apps, like the client secret or public key. They can also take limited actions on team-owned apps, like configuring interaction endpoints or resetting the bot token. Members with the Developer role cannot manage the team or its members, or take destructive actions on team-owned apps.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Entities.TeamRole.ReadOnly
member.summary: Read-only members can access information about a team and any team-owned apps. Some examples include getting the IDs of applications and exporting payout records.

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise.ThenSequence(System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Func{Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise}}})
member.summary: Chain a sequence of operations using promises. Return a collection of functions each of which starts an async operation and yields a promise. Each function will be called and each promise resolved in turn. The resulting promise is resolved after each promise is resolved in sequence.

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise.Finally(System.Action)
member.summary: Add a finally callback. Finally callbacks will always be called, even if any preceding promise is rejected, or encounters an error. The returned promise will be resolved or rejected, as per the preceding promise.

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise.ContinueWith(System.Func{Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise})
member.summary: Add a callback that chains a non-value promise. ContinueWith callbacks will always be called, even if any preceding promise is rejected, or encounters an error. The state of the returning promise will be based on the new non-value promise, not the preceding (rejected or resolved) promise.

member.name: M:Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise.ContinueWith``1(System.Func{Oxide.Ext.Discord.Interfaces.IPromise{``0}})
member.summary: Add a callback that chains a value promise (optionally converting to a different value type). ContinueWith callbacks will always be called, even if any preceding promise is rejected, or encounters an error. The state of the returning promise will be based on the new value promise, not the preceding (rejected or resolved) promise.

member.typeparam: The return type of the placeholder callback

member.param: The name of the data key in PlaceholderData
member.typeparam: The return type of the placeholder callback

member.name: T:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode
member.summary: Represents Socket Close Event Codes

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.UnknownError
member.summary: We're not sure what went wrong. Try reconnecting?

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.UnknownOpcode
member.summary: You sent an invalid Gateway opcode or an invalid payload for an opcode. Don't do that!

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.DecodeError
member.summary: You sent an invalid payload to us. Don't do that!

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.NotAuthenticated
member.summary: You sent us a payload prior to identifying.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.AuthenticationFailed
member.summary: The account token sent with your identify payload is incorrect.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.AlreadyAuthenticated
member.summary: You sent more than one identify payload. Don't do that!

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.InvalidSequence
member.summary: The sequence sent when resuming the session was invalid. Reconnect and start a new session.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.RateLimited
member.summary: Woah nelly! You're sending payloads to us too quickly. Slow it down! You will be disconnected on receiving this.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.SessionTimedOut
member.summary: Your session timed out. Reconnect and start a new one.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.InvalidShard
member.summary: You sent us an invalid shard when identifying.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.ShardingRequired
member.summary: The session would have handled too many guilds - you are required to shard your connection in order to connect.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.InvalidApiVersion
member.summary: You sent an invalid version for the gateway.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.InvalidIntents
member.summary: You sent an invalid intent for a Gateway Intent. You may have incorrectly calculated the bitwise value.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.DisallowedIntent
member.summary: You sent a disallowed intent for a Gateway Intent. You may have tried to specify an intent that you have not enabled or are not whitelisted for.

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.DiscordExtensionReconnect
member.summary: Used to identify a reconnect should occur to discord

member.name: F:Oxide.Ext.Discord.WebSockets.DiscordWebsocketCloseCode.UnknownCloseCode
member.summary: Used when a code is sent that we don't have yet.

members.member:
* From Discord API docs: * The user object within this event can be partial, the only field which must be sent is the id field, everything else is optional. * Along with this limitation, no fields are required, and the types of the fields are not validated. * Your client should expect any combination of fields and types within this event
https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway#presence-update
